sect1.title: What's New in &app; &appversion;
sect1.para: You can find a complete list of bugs fixed and features added in the News and ChangeLog files supplied with the package. See the source tarball of pybliographer, or the default doc directory of your distribution (e.g. /usr/share/doc/pybliographer). Some of the features include:

listitem.para: Shortcut keys have been added for Add and Edit menu items.

To simplify selection of an existing local file in the Edit window, fields of type URL come now equipped with a button to the right of the entry widget, that starts a File selection dialog. With this dialog, the user can navigate the directories, and select an existing file. If the dialog is left through the OK button, this file will become the new value of the field in question.
&app; &appversion; adds new features to help in the management and use of *Resources*, i.e. files referred to from an item, such as Eprints and other electronic versions of it.

You can set the viewable fields and the applications used to view the resources in the 'Resource' tab under the SettingsPreferences menu. If an item contains one or more fields containing viewable resources, it is marked with an icon at the left edge of the item in the main window. The available resources are presented to the user under both the View Resource submenu item and the Resource pop up menu provided for the item list.

The @preamble items at the beginning of a BibTeX file (.bib) are conserved now by default. They are no longer effectively deleted upon saving the file. This feature requires python-bibtex 1.2.2 or later.
If the previous behaviour (i.e. deleting the preamble upon saving or copying the file) is wanted, it can be switched off in Preferences. (This option is for compatibility only.)
A new bibtex field type (BIBTEX_VERBATIM) is used for urls and references. This type ensures symbols like ~ don't get escaped.
A new menu item and dialog has been added for opening URLs. See the FileOpen Location menu.
File selector is simplified; it supports only the gtk 2.4 FileChooser, and the URL entry has been removed.
The GUI code is updated so that it is compatible with pygtk 2.4. &app; &appversion; requires pygtk 2.4.0 or later.
The possibility of autosaving opened database files has been added. There is a toggle in preferences to switch on autosaving. The time interval also can be adjusted.
Creating backup copy of files before saving is optional. There is an option in preferences for switching off backup (default is ON).
Hitting escape in the main window resets the search filter.
The file info (both the style and output file) is preserved across runs of the format menu. The Format dialog uses the new file selector now.

varlistentry.term: Added a small notification of the current query

listitem.para: When the query is limited, the name of the query is displayed in the bottom bar.
When closing a modified database (file), it is asked whether or not to save the database. The old behaviour can be obtained by setting the old-confirmation-dialog option in preferences.
Many bugs (e.g. bugs related to sort and isifile issues, fileselector, config editor) are fixed.
Updated translations.
